intro: Vaccinium jefense, commonly known as the Jefense blueberry, is a species of shrub native to the temperate regions of the northern hemisphere. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes other familiar plants like heathers and cranberries. The plant produces small, edible berries that are typically dark blue or purple in color. These berries are rich in antioxidants and are often used in culinary applications. Vaccinium jefense thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and requires partial to full sunlight for optimal growth.
